column4: This might not be the appropriate channel for this question but I'm not sure where to begin
this channel is for ubuntu support
well I am running on 10.04 - I'll explain briefly and maybe you can help guide me :-)
I have a program that calls 'uname -n' and I need to figure out how to intercept the call and run a different command
as in, instead of calling uname -n it does something else
as in it does call uname -n but I'm trying to run it in a cluster so I want it use something like host x.x.x.x
it's a binary so I can't just change the command like in an init script
then I would suggest not doing it
changing binaries is just a no go unless you have the source
maybe not even close but could you wrap the program somehow and redirect it when it tries to call uname?
me - I wouldn't uname is important, so trying to put a wrapper around it isn't something I'd suggest
no I wouldn't want to do that! figured it would break lots of things!
wanted to know if I could wrap the binary that goes looking for uname (that I don't have source for)
too bad :-(  thanks for the help though!
apologies, just being honest for a solution
not your fault - windows companies aren't very linux helpful!
